poem:
Tariff Threat  

The grapes entangled—  
their journey halted,  
froth of Champagne  
stilled in its cask,  
ocean unease,  
a whisper disturbed.  

Across the table,   
a farmer lingers,  
empty glasses,  
vines in silence.  
Barriers rise,  
like walls of cold duty  
between nations,   
invisible yet sharp—  
let us gather    
what remains  
in gentle, lighter sips.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Donald Trump threatens 200% tariff on EU wine and champagne Donald Trump has threatened a 200% tariff on wine and champagne from European Union countries, in the latest threat of escalation in the global trade war started by the US president against the country’s biggest trading partners. Trump said in a post on Thursday on his Truth Social platform that the tariffs on all alcoholic products from the bloc would be retaliation for a “nasty”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Donald Trump threatens 200% tariff on EU wine and champagne Donald Trump has threatened a 200% tariff on wine and champagne from European Union countries, in the latest threat of escalation in the global trade war started by the US president against the country’s biggest trading partners. Trump said in a post on Thursday on his Truth Social platform that the tariffs on all alcoholic products from the bloc would be retaliation for a “nasty”
